Result.Title: League tables and their limitations: statistical issues in comparisons of institutional performance

Result.Abstract: SUMMARY Models for the analysis of hierarchically structured data are discussed. An iterative generalized least squares estimation procedure is given and shown to be equivalent to maximum likelihood in the normal case. There is a discussion of applications to complex surveys, longitudinal data, and estimation in multivariate models with missing re- sponses. An example is given using educational data.
Result.Title: Multilevel mixed linear model analysis using iterative generalized least squares

Result.Title: Improved Approximations for Multilevel Models with Binary Responses

Result.Title: Smoking in Pregnancy and Subsequent Child Development

Result.Title: Cigarette Smoking in Pregnancy: Its Influence on Birth Weight and Perinatal Mortality

Result.Title: Differential school effectiveness

Result.Title: Methods in School Effectiveness Research

Result.Abstract: A common application of multilevel models is to apportion the variance in the response according to the different levels of the data. Whereas partitioning variances is straightforward in models with a continuous response variable with a normal error distribution at each level, the extension of this partitioning to models with binary responses or to proportions or counts is less obvious.

Result.Title: Efficient statistical modelling of longitudinal data

Result.Title: A MultiLevel Analysis of School Improvement: Changes in Schools' Performance over Time

Result.Abstract: Summary. Models for fitting longitudinal binary responses are explored by using a panel study of voting intentions. A standard multilevel repeated measures logistic model is shown to be inadequate owing to a substantial proportion of respondents who maintain a constant response over time. A multivariate binary response model is shown to be a better fit to the data.
